summary: A fully featured configuration of quality and performance in equal measure, now come's in two flavours. Also includes system memory usage/performance optimization and shadow enhancement which boosts performance levels by 15-20% competing directly with High Preset.
descriptionHtml:
This modification started off as a config I used to tweak performance on a Dell Inspirion 15R N5110. I developed the config so that it allowed me to run the mods I liked without suffering a performance impact while increasing quality the game engine allowed. The modification now comes in two configurations, one prioritizing quality & the other prioritizing performance but neglects neither, vise versa.

[b][u]Featuring:[/u][/b]

[b]Multisampled Anti-Aliasing
Transparency Anti-Aliasing
Anisotropic Filtering
Deferred Shadows
Depth of Field
Radial Blur
High Dynamic Range
Water Reflections
Shadows on World, Trees, Grass
Character Self-shadowing[/b]

[b][u]Also feature's:[/u][/b]
[b]Multi-threading Optimization
Memory Optimization
Object Loading Optimization[/b]

I performed a comparison between built-in quality presets & my very own config, the comparison is as follows:

[u]Skyrim Enhanced Shadow and Performance Improvement Config vs High Pre-set with [2x Anti-Aliasing, 16x Anisotropic Filtering]:[/u]

TESV Skyrim High Preset 2AA 16AF with Mods [Indoors]:
Frames, Time (ms), Min, Max, Avg
2112, 60000, 32, 37, 35.200

Skyrim Enhanced Shadow and Performance Improvement Config with Mods [Indoors]:
Frames, Time (ms), Min, Max, Avg
2661, 60000, 39, 47, 44.350

[i]Performance Improvement with mods = 20%[/i]

TESV Skyrim High Preset 2AA 16AF without Mods [Indoors]:
Frames, Time (ms), Min, Max, Avg
2672, 60000, 42, 47, 44.533

Skyrim Enhanced Shadow and Performance Improvement Config without Mods [Indoors]:
Frames, Time (ms), Min, Max, Avg
3563, 60000, 53, 63, 59.383

[i]Performance Improvement without mods = 20%[/i]

TESV Skyrim High Preset 2AA 16AF with Mods [Outdoors]:
Frames, Time (ms), Min, Max, Avg
2564, 58095, 38, 49, 44.135

Skyrim Enhanced Shadow and Performance Improvement Config with Mods [Outdoors]:
Frames, Time (ms), Min, Max, Avg
3016, 58043, 39, 59, 51.961

[i]Performance Improvement with mods = 15%[/i]

TESV Skyrim High Preset 2AA 16AF without Mods [Outdoors]:
Frames, Time (ms), Min, Max, Avg
2556, 57990, 37, 49, 44.077

Skyrim Enhanced Shadow and Performance Improvement Config without Mods [Outdoors]:
Frames, Time (ms), Min, Max, Avg
3036, 58491, 42, 59, 51.905

[i]Performance Improvement without mods = 15%[/i]

[b]Note:[/b]
[i]"Indoors" is an interior benchmark of Jorrvasker stood still with a view of the building and it's npc's during a boxing contest. 
"Outdoors" is an exterior benchmark which includes 3rd person view running in a straight line on the path & river to the bridge at the waterfalls.[/i]


[u]Installation:[/u]

Extract .rar contents directly into your "Skyrim" folder, eg. "C:\Users\'Your username'\Documents\My Games\Skyrim" overwrite existing file, backup before hand is optional but not essential as deleting the file and restarting the game will create a new default config based on your hardware.

CTRL+F in notepad to find the line [- sD3DDevice="YOUR RENDER DEVICE HERE" -] and replace it with the graphics chip name from your "RendererInfo.txt" file ! Otherwise hardware detection will occur and you'll have to redo extraction.

[b][i]For nVidia graphics use the following format, a space behind the graphics chip name otherwise defaults will be used[/b][/i]
Example: sD3DDevice="NVIDIA GeForce GT 525M "

[b][i]For ATi graphics use the following format, no spacing behind the graphics chip name otherwise defaults will be used[/b][/i]
Example: sD3DDevice="AMD Radeon HD 7800 Series"


[u]System's used during development:[/u]

[u]Laptop[/u]
Processor :-::-:  Intel 2nd Gen Core i5-2450M @ 2.5Ghz (3.1Ghz Max Turbo)
Memory :-::-: 6GB DDR3 @ 1333Mhz (Dual Channel)
Video Card :-::-: nVidia GeForce GT 525m with 1GB GDDR3 Memory (Dedicated)
Video Driver :-::-: nVidia ForceWare 310.90 WHQL
Display :-::-: 15" Screen @ 1366x768 Resolution (TrueLife Screen)
Operating System :-::-: Windows 7 Home Premium 64bit (Service Pack 1)

[b]Note:[/b]
[i]The GT525M is loosely similar in performance as GeForce 8800 GT, 9800 GT, GT 240, GT 430, GT 530, GT 620 and upwards in each series, so it should suit the majority of nVidia hardware.[/i]

[u]Desktop[/u]
Case :-::-: Xigmatek Asgard Midi Tower
Operating System :-::-: Windows 7 Home Premium 64bit SP1
Processor :-::-: Intel Core i5 S 760 2.53Ghz @ 3.8 Ghz
CPU Cooler :-::-: Cooler Master: Hyper 212 EVO
Thermal Compound :-::-: Arctic Silver 5
Motherboard :-::-: Asus P7P55D
Memory :-::-: OCZ XTC Platinum 4GB @ 1600 Mhz Dual Channel
Hard Disks :-::-: 120GB SanDisk Extreme, 1TB Seagate Barracuda
Display :-::-: LG Flatron W2261VP 22" 1080P LCD
Video Card :-::-: MSI R7850 Twin Frozr 2GB GDDR5 OC
Video Driver :-::-: ATi Catalyst 13.9 WHQL [Defaults]
Speakers :-::-: Goodmans Bass Reflex Stereo System
Audio:-::-: VIA VT1828S 8-Channel HD Audio CODEC [Onboard]
Mouse :-::-: Razer Deathadder Re-Spawn 3500dpi
Surfaces :-::-: SteelSeries QcK, SteelSeries S&S
Keyboard :-::-: Logitech Internet Pro - Black [PS/2 Connection]
author: demon_uk2001
